snippet: For many residents in the city’s predominantly white neighborhoods, the poverty and troubled schools of gritty West Baltimore are distant troubles they rarely encounter.
abstract: Residents in Baltimore's predominantly white neighborhoods say they have not had to deal with level of turmoil and civil unrest that has plagued West Baltimore; many remain optimistic that city will enter a period of reconciliation following demonstrations over death of Freddie Gray while in custody of police officers.
lead_paragraph: For many residents in the city’s predominantly white neighborhoods, the poverty and troubled schools of gritty West Baltimore are distant troubles they rarely encounter.

headline.main: Baltimore Residents Away From Turmoil Consider Their Role
headline.print_headline: Baltimore Residents Away From Turmoil Consider Their Role
